meanings.def: a person who is the official head of a country or region that is governed by another country
examples: the former governor of the colony
He was confirmed as the provincial governor for another five-year term.
The report was written by Chris Patten, the former governor of Hong Kong.
She was appointed as acting governor until an election could be held.
They voted to recall the sitting governor.
He will take office as interim governor pending fresh elections.

meanings.def: a person who is chosen to be in charge of the government of a state in the US
examples: She has officially launched her campaign to become state governor.
Governor Jon Corzine of New Jersey

meanings.def: a member of a group of people who are responsible for controlling an institution such as a school, a college or a hospital
examples: One way of getting things changed is to become a school governor.
the board of governors of the college
She served as a parent governor at her children's school.
I'll have to present my plan to the board of governors.

meanings.def: a person who is in charge of an institution
examples: A copy of the report was sent to the prison governor.
He is a former governor of the Bank of England.
(informal) I can't decide. I'll have to ask the governor (= the man in charge, who employs somebody).
